intro: Ctenium nubicum var. somalense, commonly known as Somali ctenium, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is adapted to thrive in dry environments, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand high temperatures. This species is often found in sandy soils and is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
